availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Landaff Watson Andrews (Fleming County Politician/10th Circuit Court Judge/Fleming Co Lawyer)

body.p: Native of Kentucky. Fleming County attorney, legislator, and Tenth Circuit Court Judge. Married Elizabeth Dorsey Andrews in 1826. Graduated from Transylvania University in 1824. Admitted to the bar in 1826. Fleming County attorney from 1828 to 1839. Served in the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1834 and 1838. Andrews served as a U.S. Congressman of the Whig Party from 1839 until 1843. Served in the Kentucky Senate from 1857 to 1861. Served in the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1861 to 1862. He then became the judge of the Tenth Circuit Court from 1862 to 1868.

bibl.p: The Evening Bulletin, December 21, 1888, page 3. U.S. Find a Grave Index, 1600-Present, Landaff Watson Andrews, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=7669613&ref=acom accessed 03/03/2017. Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, History of Kentucky, Volume II (Covington, KY: Collins and Company, 1878), p. 230-231. Sixty-first U.S. Congress, *Senate Documents, Volume 56: Biographical Congressional Directory (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1913), p. 442. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Flemingsburg, p. 256. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Flemingsburg, District 2, p. 13. Fleming County, Kentucky, Marriage Index, 1798-1857, Ancestry, 1826.
